Sir:

In reply to yours of November 29th regarding responsibility for water in Basement of the new Central School Caughnawaga, according to your letter you consider that it was our duty to take necessary precaution to prevent the admission of water into the basement. We would like you kindly to take note that our sewer outlet was close and also the cement floor in the basement as been finish since October 12th and for the Artisan well was not a part of our contract nor was no benefit to us as your letter state we took advantage off as we knew our water from river for our concrete, as for a coping or plugging the artisan well we had no authority to do so. Kindly take note that this water did not come in from the well in the day it start in on a sunday night November the 13th. Kindly take note that we notify your engineer Mr. J.D. O'Brien by telephone November the 15th of the circumstance.
of the well, as we would not be responsible for delay or damage done from same, and he advised us to open the mouth of drain and proceed to pump it out which after we found was going to cost the Department too much as you would have to keep a pump day and night, and after having pumped it days we find out that the same water was backing through the rock which we notify your engineer of same as we were not responsible in any one way or the other, as the sewer was not constructed from the building.

Kindly take note that the furnaces were in and the heating system could have been completed if it was not for this water from the well.

As it is now your engineer arrange with us to supply coke to keep this water from freezing till such time as this water goes down if we supply temporary furnaces.

Kindly take note, as to your letter of the 17th advising us to go ahead with sewer for Central school we advise your engineer Mr. J. D. and so it is solid rock it will take sometime before it finish we expect it will run the middle of January to the 1st of February.

Referring to your same letter re-brick veneering not been started several weeks ago kindly take note to your letter of October the 5th when we were ready to start brick you advise us to lay this bricks with a rope joint which was not in the specifications 3/8" deep, we reply to same stating it would cost an extra, which we got no reply till November the 1st in which time the Department delayed us twenty-five days. Kindly take note that the roof has been finished for sometime outside of certain portion that cannot be done till after brickwork is finished, as it has to be flash up to brickwork as this is Asbestos shingles and not wooden shingle as if there is any delay in the building being not finish at the date stipulated we considered it is the Department's fault as we were awarded the contract on July the 9th and could not

Sir:

re: progress of the work at the new Central School.

I beg to inform you that the contractors MacKenzie & Genest are at work for the construction of the drainage system for the above mentioned school. The work, however, is proceeding very slowly. Yesterday, they had three men at work for the drilling of about 25 holes that are already bored to an average depth of four feet into the solid rock, a length of approximately 100 feet from the river side. Needless to say the this kind of work is proceeded with very slowly.

Referring to your letter of the 1st instant to the Contractors, I beg to inform you that the circular opening, referred to therein, has not yet been made by them.

The brick laying on the outside walls is also proceeded with very slowly on account of the severe temperature. I have noticed that the joints are not always properly made in accordance with the specifications. This is also probably due to the severe temperature during last week.

The second coat of the plastering into the concert hall is now completed.

There is about 12 inches deep of water yet into the boiler room.

Your obedient servant,

[Signature]

The Secretary,
Department of Indian Affairs,
OTTAWA.
Sir,

An Indian by the name of Angus Phillips of Caughnawaga has applied to this Department for payment of $7.20 for wages due him for the carting of gravel to level the roadway along the water pipe line leading to the girls' school, from the Mission building, at the time that the water pipe was thawed out some three years ago. He claims to have worked two days, under the supervision of Peter Viano, who omitted his name from the pay list. In view of the explanation given by him I would ask you to interview him personally, and prepare the necessary vouchers covering this amount, and forward same to the Department for consideration.

Your obedient servant,

A. F. MacKenzie,
